action.action-desc: Mr. Landsman (for himself, Mr. Luttrell, Mr. Deluzio, and Mr. Van Orden) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to establish standard practices for a grant or pilot program administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs through the Veterans Health Administration, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the What Works for Preventing Veteran Suicide Act.

section.header: Establishment of standard practices for a grant or pilot program administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs through the Veterans Health Administration

subsection.text: Section 527 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by inserting (1) before The Secretary,;
by redesignating subsections (b) and (c) as paragraphs (2) and (3), respectively; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection (b):

subsection.text: The Secretary shall prescribe regulations that establish standard practices that, unless otherwise prohibited by law, shall apply to a grant program or pilot program relating to suicide prevention or mental health carried out through the Veterans Health Administration. Such practices shall include the following:

paragraph.text: The establishment of clear and measurable objectives.
The development of a methodology and plan to—

subparagraph.text: determine information necessary to evaluate the program;
identify sources, methods, timing, and frequency for collecting of such information;
determine how such information will be analyzed to evaluate the program’s implementation and performance and to identify lessons learned; and
identify criteria or standards for informing decisions about whether the program should be expanded, extended, or made permanent.

paragraph.text: The communication of program objectives, assessment methodology, and evaluation plan with entities determined relevant to the program by the Secretary—

subparagraph.text: during the development of the program;
at least 30 days prior to the beginning of the program; and
throughout the term of the program.

paragraph.text: At the conclusion of the program, the performance of an evaluation of the program—

subparagraph.text: to assess the generalizability of the program.

paragraph.text: The sharing of program results and best practices with entities determined relevant to the program by the Secretary.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall prescribe regulations under section 527(b) of such title, as amended by subsection (a).
The standard practices prescribed in such regulations shall apply to a grant or pilot program without regard to when such program was established.
